arm_group.description: Administering acetate Ringer's solution that contains no glucose as an initial infusion A total infusion volume of acetate Ringer's solution is 1500ml

Administering the acetate Ringer's solution that contains 1% glucose as an initial infusion A total infusion volume of the acetate Ringer's solution containing 1% glucose is 1500ml (containing 15g of glucose)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of administering a small dose of
      glucose on the pregnant women and their neonates during cesarean section.  We investigate
      the safety and efficacy of use of a glucose-containing solution for the pregnant women and
      the neonates.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Administering a Small Dose of Glucose During Cesarean Section

detailed_description.textblock:
Rapid infusion of large amount of glucose is associated with fetal hyperglycemia,
      hyperinsulinemia, and neonatal hypoglycemia. However, the effect of small dose of glucose is
      unclear.  We conducted a pilot study of small dose of glucose.  We investigated the effect
      of a glucose-containing fluid on the blood sugar of the umbilical artery.  We found that in
      the case of no-glucose-containing fluid, there were some cases in which umbilical arterial
      concentration of glucose was less than 50 mg/dl, which might cause neonatal hypoglycemia.
      In addition, in the case of 1%-glucose-containing fluid, mean umbilical arterial
      concentration of glucose was 97 mg/dl.

      The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of administering a small dose of
      glucose on the pregnant women and their neonates during cesarean section.  We investigate
      the safety and efficacy of use of a glucose-containing solution for the pregnant women and
      the neonates.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing cesarean section who met the criteria of the American Society of
             Anesthesiologists physical status of 1-2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ASA physical status >=3, Obesity (BMI>35), Height>=175cm, Weight>=80Kg

intervention.description: During cesarean section under spinal anesthesia, each acetate Ringer's solution is administered before delivery.

intervention.intervention_name: acetate Ringer's solution containing no glucose

facility.name: Departiment of Anesthesiology, Nagoya City University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Administering a Small Dose of Glucose on the Pregnant Women and Their Neonates During Cesarean Section

other_outcome.measure: Evidence of clinical complications (especially, low glucose symptoms)
other_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 3 days after cesarean section

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesiology, Nagoya City Universtiy

primary_outcome.measure: The blood glucose concentration in the neonates at one hour of age

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate professor, the department of Anesthesiology

secondary_outcome.measure: The blood glucose concentration in the neonates at two hour of age

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
